pli-tv-bu-vb-sk16:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk16:0.5: 16. The second training rule on swaying the body
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk16:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk16:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were swaying and leaning their bodies while sitting in inhabited areas. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk16:1.3.1: “‘I will not sway my body while sitting in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk16:1.4: One should not sway one’s body while sitting in an inhabited area;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk16:1.5: one should sit keeping one’s body straight.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk16:1.6: If a monk, out of disrespect, sways and leans his body while sitting in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk16:1.12: if he has entered his dwelling;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk16:1.15: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk16:1.16: The sixth training rule is finished.
